name: spotinst
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing spotinst cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`spotinst` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/spotinst/terraform-provider-spotinst).

gracePeriod.description: Amount of time to wait between batches

shouldDrainInstances.description: Bool value if to wait to drain instance

timeWindow.description: Time Window for when action occurs ex. Mon:23:50-Tue:00:20

adjustment.description: The number of instances to add or remove.

adjustmentPercentage.description: The percentage of instances to add or remove.

batchSizePercentage.description: The percentage size of each batch in the scheduled deployment roll.

cronExpression.description: A valid cron expression. The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in [Unix cron format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron).

frequency.description: The recurrence frequency to run this task. Supported values are `"hourly"`, `"daily"`, `"weekly"` and `"continuous"`.

gracePeriod.description: The period of time (seconds) to wait before checking a batch's health after it's deployment.

isEnabled.description: Setting the task to being enabled or disabled.

maxCapacity.description: The maximum number of instances the group should have.

minCapacity.description: The minimum number of instances the group should have.

scaleMaxCapacity.description: The maximum number of instances the group should have.

scaleMinCapacity.description: The minimum number of instances the group should have.

scaleTargetCapacity.description: The desired number of instances the group should have.

startTime.description: Set a start time for one time tasks.

targetCapacity.description: The desired number of instances the group should have.

taskType.description: The task type to run. Supported task types are: `"scale"`, `"backup_ami"`, `"roll"`, `"scaleUp"`, `"percentageScaleUp"`, `"scaleDown"`, `"percentageScaleDown"`, `"statefulUpdateCapacity"`.

threadsPerCore.description: The ability to define the number of threads per core in instances that allow this.

deleteOnTermination.description: Whether the volume should be destroyed on instance termination.

deviceName.description: The name of the device to mount.

iops.description: The amount of provisioned [IOPS](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ebs-io-characteristics.html). This must be set with a `volume_type` of `"io1"`.

kmsKeyId.description: ID for a user managed CMK under which the EBS Volume is encrypted

throughput.description: The amount of data transferred to or from a storage device per second, you can use this param just in a case that `volume_type` = gp3.

volumeSize.description: The size of the volume in gigabytes.

volumeType.description: The type of volume. Can be `"standard"`, `"gp2"`, `"io1"`, `"st1"` or `"sc1"`.

deviceName.description: The name of the block device to mount on the instance.

batchSizePercentage.description: Sets the percentage of the instances to deploy in each batch.

gracePeriod.description: Sets the grace period for new instances to become healthy.

shouldDrainInstances.description: Specify whether to drain incoming TCP connections before terminating a server.

timeWindow.description: Time Window for when action occurs ex. Mon:23:50-Tue:00:20

cleanupOnFailure.description: Cleanup automatically after a failed deploy.

terminateInstanceOnFailure.description: Terminate the instance automatically after a failed deploy.

version.description:
The Rancher version. Must be `"1"` or `"2"`. If this field is omitted, its assumed that the Rancher cluster is version 1. Note that Kubernetes is required when using Rancher version 2^.
Usage:

domains.description: Collection of one or more domains to register.

hostedZoneId.description: The id associated with a hosted zone.

recordSetType.description: The type of the record set. Valid values: `"a"`, `"cname"`.

recordSets.description: Collection of records containing authoritative DNS information for the specified domain name.

spotinstAcctId.description: The Spotinst account ID that is linked to the AWS account that holds the Route 53 Hosted Zone ID. The default is the user Spotinst account provided as a URL parameter.

usePublicDns.description: - Designates whether the DNS address should be exposed to connections outside the VPC.

usePublicIp.description: - Designates whether the IP address should be exposed to connections outside the VPC.

httpPutResponseHopLimit.description: The desired HTTP PUT response hop limit for instance metadata requests. The larger the number, the further instance metadata requests can travel. Valid values: Integers from `1` to `64`.

httpTokens.description: The state of token usage for your instance metadata requests. Valid values: `optional` or `required`.

associateIpv6Address.description: Indicates whether to assign IPV6 addresses to your instance. Requires a subnet with IPV6 CIDR block ranges.

associatePublicIpAddress.description: Indicates whether to assign a public IP address to an instance you launch in a VPC. The public IP address can only be assigned to a network interface for eth0, and can only be assigned to a new network interface, not an existing one.

deleteOnTermination.description: If set to true, the interface is deleted when the instance is terminated.

description.description: The description of the network interface.

deviceIndex.description: The index of the device on the instance for the network interface attachment.

networkInterfaceId.description: The ID of the network interface.

privateIpAddress.description: The private IP address of the network interface.

secondaryPrivateIpAddressCount.description: The number of secondary private IP addresses.

timeWindows.description: Specify a list of time windows for to execute revertToSpot strategy. Time window format: `ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm`. Example: `Mon:03:00-Wed:02:30`

name.description: The name of the signal defined for the group. Valid Values: `"INSTANCE_READY"`, `"INSTANCE_READY_TO_SHUTDOWN"`

timeout.description: The signals defined timeout- default is 40 minutes (1800 seconds).

shouldDeleteImages.description: For stateful groups: remove persistent images.

shouldDeleteNetworkInterfaces.description: For stateful groups: remove network interfaces.

shouldDeleteVolumes.description: For stateful groups: remove persistent volumes.

autoApplyTags.description: Enables updates to tags without rolling the group when set to `true`.

rollConfig.description: While used, you can control whether the group should perform a deployment after an update to the configuration.

shouldResumeStateful.description: This will apply resuming action for Stateful instances in the Elastigroup upon scale up or capacity changes. Example usage will be for Elastigroups that will have scheduling rules to set a target capacity of 0 instances in the night and automatically restore the same state of the instances in the morning.

shouldRoll.description: Sets the enablement of the roll option.

batchSizePercentage.description: Sets the percentage of the instances to deploy in each batch.

gracePeriod.description: Sets the grace period for new instances to become healthy.

healthCheckType.description: Sets the health check type to use. Valid values: `"EC2"`, `"ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE"`, `"ELB"`, `"HCS"`, `"MLB"`, `"TARGET_GROUP"`, `"MULTAI_TARGET_SET"`, `"NONE"`.

waitForRollPercentage.description: For use with `should_roll`. Sets minimum % of roll required to complete before continuing the plan. Required if `wait_for_roll_timeout` is set.

waitForRollTimeout.description: For use with `should_roll`. Sets how long to wait for the deployed % of a roll to exceed `wait_for_roll_percentage` before continuing the plan. Required if `wait_for_roll_percentage` is set.

batchMinHealthyPercentage.description: Indicates the threshold of minimum healthy instances in single batch. If the amount of healthy instances in single batch is under the threshold, the deployment will fail. Range `1` - `100`.

onFailure.description: Set detach options to the deployment.

shouldDrainInstances.description: Specify whether to drain incoming TCP connections before terminating a server.

actionType.description: Sets the action that will take place, Accepted values are: `DETACH_OLD`, `DETACH_NEW`.

drainingTimeout.description: Indicates (in seconds) the timeout to wait until instance are detached.

shouldDecrementTargetCapacity.description: Decrementing the group target capacity after detaching the instances.

shouldHandleAllBatches.description: Indicator if the action should apply to all batches of the deployment or only the latest batch.

hostedZoneId.description: The Route 53 Hosted Zone Id for the registered Domain.

recordSetType.description: The type of the record set. Valid values: `"a"`, `"cname"`.

spotinstAcctId.description: The Spotinst account ID that is linked to the AWS account that holds the Route 53 hosted Zone Id. The default is the user Spotinst account provided as a URL parameter.

usePublicDns.description: - Designates whether the DNS address should be exposed to connections outside the VPC.

usePublicIp.description: - Designates whether the IP address should be exposed to connections outside the VPC.

arn.description: The AWS resource ARN (Required only for ALB target groups).

autoWeight.description: "Auto Weight" will automatically provide a higher weight for instances that are larger as appropriate. For example, if you have configured your Elastigroup with m4.large and m4.xlarge instances the m4.large will have half the weight of an m4.xlarge. This ensures that larger instances receive a higher number of MLB requests.

balancerId.description:
The Multai load balancer ID.
Default: lb-123456

targetSetId.description:
The Multai load target set ID.
Default: ts-123456

type.description: The resource type. Valid Values: CLASSIC, TARGET_GROUP, MULTAI_TARGET_SET.

associateIpv6Address.description:
Indicates whether to assign an IPv6 address. Amazon EC2 chooses the IPv6 addresses from the range of the subnet.
Default: false

associatePublicIpAddress.description: Indicates whether to assign a public IPv4 address to an instance you launch in a VPC. The public IP address can only be assigned to a network interface for eth0, and can only be assigned to a new network interface, not an existing one. You cannot specify more than one network interface in the request. If launching into a default subnet, the default value is true.

deviceIndex.description: The position of the network interface in the attachment order. A primary network interface has a device index of 0. If you specify a network interface when launching an instance, you must specify the device index.

cronExpression.description:
A valid cron expression. For example: " * * * * * ". The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format Cron Expression Validator Script. Only one of frequency or cronExpression should be used at a time.
Example: 0 1 * * *

frequency.description: Set frequency for the task. Valid values: "hourly", "daily", "weekly", "continuous".

isEnabled.description: Describes whether the task is enabled. When true the task should run when false it should not run.

startTime.description:
DATETIME in ISO-8601 format. Sets a start time for scheduled actions. If "frequency" or "cronExpression" are not used - the task will run only once at the start time and will then be deleted from the instance configuration.
Example: 2019-05-23T10:55:09Z

taskType.description: The task type to run. Valid values: "pause", "resume", "recycle".

autoHeadroomPercentage.description: Set the auto headroom percentage (a number in the range [0, 200]) which controls the percentage of headroom from the cluster. Relevant only when `autoscale_is_auto_config` toggled on.

autoscaleHeadroom.description: Spare resource capacity management enabling fast assignment of Pods without waiting for new resources to launch.

autoscaleIsAutoConfig.description: Automatically configure and optimize headroom resources.

resourceLimits.description: Optionally set upper and lower bounds on the resource usage of the cluster.

maxScaleDownPercentage.description: Would represent the maximum % to scale-down. Number between 1-100.

gpuPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the number of GPUS to allocate the headroom.

memoryPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the amount of memory (MB) to allocate the headroom.

numOfUnits.description: The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU and memory.

maxVcpu.description: The maximum cpu in vCPU units that can be allocated to the cluster.

memoryPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the amount of memory (MiB) to allocate for each headroom unit.

numOfUnits.description: The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU, memory and GPU.

snapshotId.description: (Optional) String. The Snapshot ID to mount by.

tagSelector.description: Key-value object, which defines an Elastic IP from the customer pool. Can be null.

tagValue.description: Elastic IP tag value. Can be null.

maxInstanceCount.description: set a maximum number of instances per launch specification. Can be null. If set, value must be greater than or equal to 0.

spotPercentage.description: When set, Ocean will proactively try to maintain as close as possible to the percentage of Spot instances out of all the Launch Spec instances.

effect.description: The effect of the taint. Valid values: `"NoSchedule"`, `"PreferNoSchedule"`, `"NoExecute"`.

arn.description: Required if type is set to TARGET_GROUP

name.description: Required if type is set to CLASSIC

type.description: Can be set to CLASSIC or TARGET_GROUP

tasks.description: The scheduling tasks for the cluster.

timeWindows.description:
Set time windows for shutdown hours. specify a list of 'timeWindows' with at least one time window Each string is in the format of - ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm ddd = day of week = Sun | Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat hh = hour 24 = 0 -23 mm = minute = 0 - 59. Time windows should not overlap. required on cluster.scheduling.isEnabled = True. API Times are in UTC
Example: Fri:15:30-Wed:14:30

Example: 0 1 * * *

autoscaleCooldown.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after a scaling activity completes before any further trigger-related scaling activities can start.

autoscaleIsEnabled.description: Specifies whether the auto scaling feature is enabled.

autoscaleLabels.description: Labels to assign to the resource.

clusterId.description: The GKE cluster ID you wish to import.

location.description: The location of your GKE cluster.

evaluationPeriods.description: Amount of cooldown evaluation periods for scale down.
Amount of cooldown evaluation periods for scale down.
Amount of cooldown evaluation periods for scale down.

autoHeadroomPercentage.description: Optionally set the auto headroom percentage, set a number between 0-200 to control the headroom % from the cluster. Relevant when isAutoConfig=true.

headroom.description: Spare resource capacity management enabling fast assignment of Pods without waiting for new resources to launch.

isAutoConfig.description: Automatically configure and optimize headroom resources.

resourceLimits.description: Optionally set upper and lower bounds on the resource usage of the cluster.

evaluationPeriods.description: The number of evaluation periods that should accumulate before a scale down action takes place.

maxScaleDownPercentage.description: Would represent the maximum % to scale-down. Number between 1-100.

cpuPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the number of CPUs to allocate the headroom. CPUs are denoted in millicores, where 1000 millicores = 1 vCPU.

gpuPerUnit.description: How much GPU allocate for headroom unit.

memoryPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the amount of memory (MiB) to allocate the headroom.

numOfUnits.description: The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU and memory.

maxMemoryGib.description: The maximum memory in GiB units that can be allocated to the cluster.

maxVcpu.description: The maximum cpu in vCpu units that can be allocated to the cluster.

locationType.description: Sets which location the backend services will be active. Valid values: `regional`, `global`.

scheme.description: Use when `location_type` is `regional`. Set the traffic for the backend service to either between the instances in the vpc or to traffic from the internet. Valid values: `INTERNAL`, `EXTERNAL`.

serviceName.description: The name of the backend service.

shutdownHours.description: Set shutdown hours for cluster object.

tasks.description: The scheduling tasks for the cluster.

timeWindows.description:
Set time windows for shutdown hours. specify a list of 'timeWindows' with at least one time window Each string is in the format of - ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm ddd = day of week = Sun | Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat hh = hour 24 = 0 -23 mm = minute = 0 - 59. Time windows should not overlap. required on cluster.scheduling.isEnabled = True. API Times are in UTC
Example: Fri:15:30-Wed:14:30

batchSizePercentage.description:
Value in % to set size of batch in roll. Valid values are 0-100
Example: 20.

cronExpression.description:
A valid cron expression. For example : " * * * * * ".The cron is running in UTC time zone and is in Unix cron format Cron Expression Validator Script. Only one of frequency or cronExpression should be used at a time. Required for cluster.scheduling.tasks object
Example: 0 1 * * *

taskType.description: Valid values: "clusterRoll". Required for cluster.scheduling.tasks object.

cpuPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the number of CPUs to allocate for each headroom unit. CPUs are denoted in millicores, where 1000 millicores = 1 vCPU.

gpuPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the number of GPUS to allocate for each headroom unit.

memoryPerUnit.description: Optionally configure the amount of memory (MiB) to allocate for each headroom unit.

numOfUnits.description: The number of units to retain as headroom, where each unit has the defined headroom CPU, memory and GPU.

effect.description: The effect of the taint. Valid values: `"NoSchedule"`, `"PreferNoSchedule"`, `"NoExecute"`.

imageName.description: Name of the custom image. Required if resource_group_name is specified.

offer.description: Name of the image to use. Required if publisher is specified.

publisher.description: Image publisher. Required if resource_group_name is not specified.

sku.description: Image's Stock Keeping Unit, which is the specific version of the image. Required if publisher is specified.

password.description: Password for admin access to Windows VMs. Required for Windows OS types.

sshPublicKey.description: SSH for admin access to Linux VMs. Required for Linux OS types.

userName.description: Set admin access for accessing your VMs.

additionalIpConfigs.description: Array of additional IP configuration objects.

privateIpVersion.description: Available from Azure Api-Version 2017-03-30 onwards, it represents whether the specific ipconfiguration is IPv4 or IPv6. Valid values: `IPv4`, `IPv6`.

drainingTimeout.description: Time (seconds) to allow the instance to be drained from incoming TCP connections and detached from MLB before terminating it during a scale-down operation.

odCount.description: Number of On-Demand instances to maintain. Required if low_priority_percentage is not specified.

healthy.description: The number of consecutive successful health checks that must occur before declaring an instance healthy.

interval.description: The amount of time (in seconds) between each health check (minimum: 10).

port.description: The port of the Spotinst HCS (default: 80).

protocol.description: The protocol to use to connect with the instance. Valid values: http, https.

timeout.description: the amount of time (in seconds) to wait when receiving a response from the health check.

unhealthy.description: The number of consecutive failed health checks that must occur before declaring an instance unhealthy.

provider.description:
The provider type for the spotinst package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

beanstalkEnvironmentId.description: The id of an existing Beanstalk environment.

beanstalkEnvironmentName.description: The name of an existing Beanstalk environment.

desiredCapacity.description: The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.

instanceTypesSpots.description: One or more instance types. To maximize the availability of Spot instances, select as many instance types as possible.

maxSize.description: The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.

minSize.description: The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.

product.description:

For EC2 Classic instances:  `"Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC)"`, `"SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC)"`, `"Windows (Amazon VPC)"`.

availabilityZones.description:
List of Strings of availability zones. When this parameter is set, `subnet_ids` should be left unused.
Note: `availability_zones` naming syntax follows the convention `availability-zone:subnet:placement-group-name`. For example, to set an AZ in `us-east-1` with subnet `subnet-123456` and placement group `ClusterI03`, you would set:
`availability_zones = ["us-east-1a:subnet-123456:ClusterI03"]`

blockDevicesMode.description: String, determine the way we attach the data volumes to the data devices, possible values: `"reattach"` and `"onLaunch"` (default is onLaunch).

capacityUnit.description: The capacity unit to launch instances by. If not specified, when choosing the weight unit, each instance will weight as the number of its vCPUs.

cpuCredits.description: Controls how T3 instances are launched. Valid values: `standard`, `unlimited`.

cpuOptions.description: The CPU options for the instances that are launched within the group:

description.description: The description of the network interface.

desiredCapacity.description: The desired number of instances the group should have at any time.

drainingTimeout.description: Indicates (in seconds) the timeout to wait until instance are detached.

ebsOptimized.description: Enable high bandwidth connectivity between instances and AWSs Elastic Block Store (EBS). For instance types that are EBS-optimized by default this parameter will be ignored.

elasticIps.description: A list of [AWS Elastic IP](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/elastic-ip-addresses-eip.html) allocation IDs to associate to the group instances.

elasticLoadBalancers.description: List of Elastic Load Balancers names (ELB).

enableMonitoring.description: Indicates whether monitoring is enabled for the instance.

fallbackToOndemand.description: In a case of no Spot instances available, Elastigroup will launch on-demand instances instead.

healthCheckGracePeriod.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to starts and check its health

healthCheckType.description: Sets the health check type to use. Valid values: `"EC2"`, `"ECS_CLUSTER_INSTANCE"`, `"ELB"`, `"HCS"`, `"MLB"`, `"TARGET_GROUP"`, `"MULTAI_TARGET_SET"`, `"NONE"`.

healthCheckUnhealthyDurationBeforeReplac.description: The amount of time, in seconds, that we will wait before replacing an instance that is running and became unhealthy (this is only applicable for instances that were once healthy)

iamInstanceProfile.description: The ARN or name of an IAM instance profile to associate with launched instances.

imageId.description: The ID of the AMI used to launch the instance.

instanceTypesOndemand.description: The type of instance determines your instance's CPU capacity, memory and storage (e.g., m1.small, c1.xlarge).

instanceTypesPreferredSpots.description: Prioritize a subset of spot instance types. Must be a subset of the selected spot instance types.

instanceTypesWeights.description: List of weights per instance type for weighted groups. Each object in the list should have the following attributes:

keyName.description: The key name that should be used for the instance.

maxSize.description: The maximum number of instances the group should have at any time.

metadataOptions.description: Data that used to configure or manage the running instances:

minSize.description: The minimum number of instances the group should have at any time.

minimumInstanceLifetime.description: Defines the preferred minimum instance lifetime. Markets which comply with this preference will be prioritized. Optional values: 1, 3, 6, 12, 24.

ondemandCount.description: Number of on demand instances to launch in the group. All other instances will be spot instances. When this parameter is set the `spot_percentage` parameter is being ignored.

orientation.description: Select a prediction strategy. Valid values: `"balanced"`, `"costOriented"`, `"equalAzDistribution"`, `"availabilityOriented"`.

persistBlockDevices.description: Boolean, should the instance maintain its Data volumes.

persistPrivateIp.description: Boolean, should the instance maintain its private IP.

persistRootDevice.description: Boolean, should the instance maintain its root device volumes.

placementTenancy.description: Enable dedicated tenancy. Note: There is a flat hourly fee for each region in which dedicated tenancy is used.

preferredAvailabilityZones.description:
The AZs to prioritize when launching Spot instances. If no markets are available in the Preferred AZs, Spot instances are launched in the non-preferred AZs. 
Note: Must be a sublist of `availability_zones` and `orientation` value must not be `"equalAzDistribution"`.

privateIps.description: List of Private IPs to associate to the group instances.(e.g. "172.1.1.0"). Please note: This setting will only apply if persistence.persist_private_ip is set to true.

product.description:
Operation system type. Valid values: `"Linux/UNIX"`, `"SUSE Linux"`, `"Windows"`. 
For EC2 Classic instances:  `"Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC)"`, `"SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC)"`, `"Windows (Amazon VPC)"`.

The AWS region your group will be created in.
Note: This parameter is required if you specify subnets (through subnet_ids). This parameter is optional if you specify Availability Zones (through availability_zones).

revertToSpot.description: Hold settings for strategy correction  replacing On-Demand for Spot instances. Supported Values: `"never"`, `"always"`, `"timeWindow"`

securityGroups.description: A list of associated security group IDS.

shutdownScript.description: The Base64-encoded shutdown script that executes prior to instance termination, for more information please see: [Shutdown Script](https://api.spotinst.com/integration-docs/elastigroup/concepts/compute-concepts/shutdown-scripts/)

spotPercentage.description: The percentage of Spot instances that would spin up from the `desired_capacity` number.

tags.description: A key/value mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

targetGroupArns.description: List of Target Group ARNs to register the instances to.

userData.description: The user data to provide when launching the instance.

utilizeReservedInstances.description: In a case of any available reserved instances, Elastigroup will utilize them first before purchasing Spot instances.

spotinst:aws/managedInstance:ManagedInst.description:
Provides a Spotinst AWS ManagedInstance resource.

{{% examples %}}
## Example Usage
{{% example %}}

```typescript
import * as pulumi from "@pulumi/pulumi";
import * as spotinst from "@pulumi/spotinst";

// Create a Manged Instance
const default_managed_instance = new spotinst.aws.ManagedInstance("default-managed-instance", {
    autoHealing: true,
    blockDevicesMode: "reattach",
    cpuCredits: "standard",
    description: "created by Pulumi",
    drainingTimeout: 120,
    ebsOptimized: true,
    elasticIp: "ip",
    enableMonitoring: true,
    fallbackToOndemand: false,
    gracePeriod: 180,
    healthCheckType: "EC2",
    iamInstanceProfile: "iam-profile",
    imageId: "ami-1234",
    instanceTypes: [
        "t1.micro",
        "t3.medium",
        "t3.large",
        "t2.medium",
        "t2.large",
        "z1d.large",
    ],
    keyPair: "labs-oregon",
    lifeCycle: "on_demand",
    optimizationWindows: ["Mon:03:00-Wed:02:20"],
    orientation: "balanced",
    persistBlockDevices: true,
    persistPrivateIp: false,
    persistRootDevice: true,
    placementTenancy: "default",
    preferredType: "t1.micro",
    privateIp: "ip",
    product: "Linux/UNIX",
    region: "us-west-2",
    revertToSpot: {
        performAt: "always",
    },
    securityGroupIds: ["sg-234"],
    shutdownScript: "managed instance bye world",
    subnetIds: ["subnet-123"],
    tags: [
        {
            key: "explicit1",
            value: "value1",
        },
        {
            key: "explicit2",
            value: "value2",
        },
    ],
    unhealthyDuration: 60,
    userData: "managed instance hello world",
    utilizeReservedInstances: true,
    vpcId: "vpc-123",
});
```
{{% /example %}}
{{% /examples %}}

autoHealing.description: Enable the auto healing which auto replaces the instance in case the health check fails, default: `"true"`.

blockDevicesMode.description:
Determine the way we attach the data volumes to the data devices. Valid values: `"reattach"`, `"onLaunch"`.
Default: `"onLaunch"`.

cpuCredits.description:
cpuCredits can have one of two values: `"unlimited"`, `"standard"`.
Default: unlimited

drainingTimeout.description: The time in seconds to allow the instance be drained from incoming TCP connections and detached from ELB before terminating it, during a scale down operation.

ebsOptimized.description:
Enable EBS optimization for supported instances. Note: Additional charges will be applied by the Cloud Provider.
Default: false

elasticIp.description: Elastic IP Allocation Id to associate to the instance.

enableMonitoring.description:
Describes whether instance Enhanced Monitoring is enabled.
Default: false

gracePeriod.description: The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to starts and check its health, default `"120"`.

healthCheckType.description:
The service to use for the health check. Valid values: `"EC2"`, `"ELB"`, `"TARGET_GROUP"`, `"MULTAI_TARGET_SET"`.
Default: `"EC2"`.

iamInstanceProfile.description: Set IAM profile to instance. Set only one of ARN or Name.

imageId.description: The ID of the image used to launch the instance.

instanceTypes.description: Comma separated list of available instance types for instance.

keyPair.description: Specify a Key Pair to attach to the instances.

optimizationWindows.description: When `performAt` is `"timeWindow"`: must specify a list of `"timeWindows"` with at least one time window. Each string should be formatted as `ddd:hh:mm-ddd:hh:mm` (ddd = day of week = Sun | Mon | Tue | Wed | Thu | Fri | Sat hh = hour 24 = 0 -23 mm = minute = 0 - 59).

orientation.description:
Select a prediction strategy. Valid values: `"balanced"`, `"costOriented"`, `"availabilityOriented"`, `"cheapest"`.
Default: `"availabilityOriented"`.

persistPrivateIp.description: Should the instance maintain its private IP.

persistRootDevice.description: Should the instance maintain its root device volumes.

coreEbsBlockDevices.description: This determines the ebs configuration for your core group instances. Only a single block is allowed.

coreEbsOptimized.description: EBS Optimization setting for instances in group.

coreInstanceTypes.description: The MrScaler instance types for the core nodes.

coreLifecycle.description: The MrScaler lifecycle for instances in core group. Allowed values are 'SPOT' and 'ON_DEMAND'.

coreUnit.description: Unit of task group for target, min and max. The unit could be `instance` or `weight`. instance - amount of instances. weight - amount of vCPU.

keepJobFlowAlive.description: Specifies whether the cluster should remain available after completing all steps.

securityConfig.description: The name of the security configuration applied to the cluster.

name.description: The name of the health check.

resourceId.description: The ID of the resource to check.

endpoint.description: The endpoint the notification will be sent to. url in case of `"http"`/`"https"`/`"web"`, email address in case of `"email"`/`"email-json"` and sns-topic-arn in case of `"aws-sns"`.

eventType.description:
The event to send the notification when triggered. Valid values: `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATED"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_READY_SIGNAL_TIMEOUT"`, `"AWS_EC2_CANT_SPIN_OD"`, `"AWS_EC2_INSTANCE_UNHEALTHY_IN_ELB"`, `"GROUP_ROLL_FAILED"`, `"GROUP_ROLL_FINISHED"`,
`"CANT_SCALE_UP_GROUP_MAX_CAPACITY"`,
`"GROUP_UPDATED"`,
`"AWS_EMR_PROVISION_TIMEOUT"`,
`"GROUP_BEANSTALK_INIT_READY"`,
`"AZURE_VM_TERMINATED"`,
`"AZURE_VM_TERMINATE"`,
`"AWS_EC2_MANAGED_INSTANCE_PAUSING"`,
`"AWS_EC2_MANAGED_INSTANCE_RESUMING"`,
`"AWS_EC2_MANAGED_INSTANCE_RECYCLING"`,`"AWS_EC2_MANAGED_INSTANCE_DELETING"`.
Ocean Events:`"CLUSTER_ROLL_FINISHED"`,`"GROUP_ROLL_FAILED"`.

protocol.description:
The protocol to send the notification. Valid values: `"email"`, `"email-json"`, `"aws-sns"`, `"web"`. 
The following values are deprecated: `"http"` , `"https"`
You can use the generic `"web"` protocol instead.
`"aws-sns"` is only supported with AWS provider
